boat.name: Pudding Faces
boat.full_description: Brian Kennel the builder states: "First produced in the early 1970s from one of the last wooden dinghies built by master craftsman Alf Last of Cooks Barge Yard Maldon; it has been evolving ever since. Early versions were sold to yacht and smack owners as tenders and many shells were fitted out by enthusiastic amateurs. By the late 1980's the mound was worn out and an injection of cash and enthusiasm was needed."
boat.construction_details: GRP simulated clinker, iroko fit out.
boat.short_description: Mould for the hull was taken from one of the last wooden dinghies built by Alf Last.
